meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to regulate the conduct of interception of communications and the use of surveillance devices by or on behalf of public officers and to provide for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Interception of Communications and Surveillance Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: authorizing officer (授權人員), in relation to any department, means any officer designated under section 7 by the head of the department to be an authorizing officer;
code of practice (實務守則) means the code of practice issued under section 63;

def.name: Communication
def.leadIn: communication (通訊) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any communication transmitted by a postal service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any communication transmitted by a telecommunications system;

subsection.def: communication transmitted by a postal service (藉郵政服務傳送的通訊) includes a postal article;

def.name: Copy
def.leadIn: copy (文本)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any contents of a communication that have been obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization for interception, means any of the following (whether or not in documentary form)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any copy, extract or summary of such contents;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any record referring to the interception which is a record showing, directly or indirectly, the identity of any person who is the sender or intended recipient of the communication; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any material that has been obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization for covert surveillance, means any of the following (whether or not in documentary form)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any copy, extract or summary of the material;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any transcript or record made of the material;

def.name: Court
def.leadIn: court (法院), without prejudice to sections 6(4) and 55—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a court as defined in section 3 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes a magistrate and a tribunal;

def.name: CovertSurveillance
def.leadIn: covert surveillance (秘密監察)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means any surveillance carried out with the use of any surveillance device for the purposes of a specific investigation or operation, if the surveillance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is carried out in circumstances where any person who is the subject of the surveillance is entitled to a reasonable expectation of privacy;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is carried out in a manner calculated to ensure that the person is unaware that the surveillance is or may be taking place; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is likely to result in the obtaining of any private information about the person; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any spontaneous reaction to unforeseen events or circumstances; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any such surveillance that constitutes interception under this Ordinance;

def.name: DataSurveillanceDevice
def.leadIn: data surveillance device (數據監察器材)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any device or program used to monitor or record the input of information into, or the output of information from, any information system by electronic means; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include an optical surveillance device;

def.name: Department
def.leadIn: department (部門)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to interception (including any application for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization for interception, any prescribed authorization for interception and any other matter relating to interception), means a department specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to covert surveillance (including any application for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization for covert surveillance, any prescribed authorization for covert surveillance and any other matter relating to covert surveillance), means a department specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to any other matter provided for in this Ordinance, means a department specified in Part 1 or 2 of Schedule 1;

def.name: DeviceRetrievalWarrant
def.leadIn: device retrieval warrant (器材取出手令) means a device retrieval warrant issued under section 34 and, where the context requires, includes— (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a device retrieval warrant to be issued under that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a device retrieval warrant that has been partially revoked under section 38A; (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

subsection.def: directorate officer (首長級人員) means an officer not below a rank equivalent to that of chief superintendent of police;

def.name: EmergencyAuthorization
def.leadIn: emergency authorization (緊急授權) means an emergency authorization issued under Division 4 of Part 3 and, where the context requires, includes— (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an emergency authorization to be issued under that Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an emergency authorization that has been partially revoked under Part 5; (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

subsection.def: enhancement equipment (增強設備), in relation to a device, means any equipment used to enhance a signal, image or other information obtained by the use of the device;

examination (審查) means an examination (including consideration of the application for the examination) carried out under Division 3 of Part 4 (and, where the context requires, includes such an examination to be carried out under that Division);

def.name: ExecutiveAuthorization
def.leadIn: executive authorization (行政授權) means an executive authorization issued or renewed under Division 3 of Part 3 and, where the context requires, includes— (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an executive authorization to be issued or renewed under that Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an executive authorization that has been partially revoked under Part 5; (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

subsection.def: function (職能) includes power and duty;
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);
install (裝設) includes attach;

intercepting act (截取作為), in relation to any communication, means the inspection of some or all of the contents of the communication, in the course of its transmission by a postal service or by a telecommunications system, by a person other than its sender or intended recipient;

def.name: Interception
def.leadIn: interception (截取)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to any communication, means the carrying out of any intercepting act in respect of that communication; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when appearing in a context with no specific reference to any communication, means the carrying out of any intercepting act in respect of any communication;

subsection.def: interception product (截取成果) means any contents of a communication that have been obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization for interception, and includes a copy of such contents;
journalistic material (新聞材料) has the meaning assigned to it by section 82 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

def.name: JudgesAuthorization
def.leadIn: judge’s authorization (法官授權) means a judge’s authorization issued or renewed under Division 2 of Part 3 and, where the context requires, includes— (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a judge’s authorization to be issued or renewed under that Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a judge’s authorization that has been partially revoked under Part 5; (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 3)

def.name: ListeningDevice
def.leadIn: listening device (監聽器材)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any device used to overhear, listen to, monitor or record any conversation or words spoken to or by any person in conversation; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a hearing aid or similar device used by a person with impaired hearing to overcome the impairment;

def.name: Maintain
def.leadIn: maintain (維修), in relation to a device, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adjust, reposition, repair or service the device; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: replace the device when it is faulty;

def.name: OpticalSurveillanceDevice
def.leadIn: optical surveillance device (視光監察器材)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any device used to record visually or observe any activity; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include spectacles, contact lenses or a similar device used by a person with impaired sight to overcome the impairment;

subsection.def: oral application (口頭申請) means an oral application made under section 25(1);
panel judge (小組法官) means a judge appointed under section 6(1) to be a panel judge;
postal article (郵遞品) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Post Office Ordinance (Cap. 98);
postal interception (郵件截取) means interception of any communication transmitted by a postal service;
postal service (郵政服務) means postal service to which the Post Office Ordinance (Cap. 98) applies;

def.name: Premises
def.leadIn: premises (處所) includes any place and, in particular, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any land or building;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any conveyance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any structure (whether or not movable or offshore); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any part of any of the premises described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c);

subsection.def: prescribed authorization (訂明授權) means a judge’s authorization, an executive authorization or an emergency authorization;
protected product (受保護成果) means any interception product or surveillance product;

def.name: PublicPlace
def.leadIn: public place (公眾地方)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any premises which are a public place as defined in section 2(1) of the Summary Offences Ordinance (Cap. 228); but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include any such premises that are intended for use by members of the public as a lavatory or as a place for taking a bath or changing clothes;

subsection.def: public security (公共安全) means the public security of Hong Kong;

def.name: RelevantAuthority
def.leadIn: relevant authority (有關當局)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for the issue or renewal of a judge’s authorization, means the panel judge to whom the application is or has been made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for the issue or renewal of an executive authorization, means the authorizing officer to whom the application is or has been made; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for the issue of an emergency authorization, means the head of a department to whom the application is or has been made;

subsection.def: relevant purpose (有關目的), in relation to a prescribed authorization, means the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned as described in section 3 for the purpose of the issue or renewal, or the continuance, of the prescribed authorization;

def.name: RelevantRequirement
def.leadIn: relevant requirement (有關規定) means any applicable requirement under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the code of practice; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant concerned;

def.name: SeriousCrime
def.leadIn: serious crime (嚴重罪行) means any offence punishable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the issue or renewal, or the continuance, of a prescribed authorization for interception, by a maximum penalty that is or includes a term of imprisonment of not less than 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the issue or renewal, or the continuance, of a prescribed authorization for covert surveillance, by a maximum penalty that is or includes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a term of imprisonment of not less than 3 years; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a fine of not less than $1,000,000;

def.name: SurveillanceDevice
def.leadIn: surveillance device (監察器材) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data surveillance device, a listening device, an optical surveillance device or a tracking device;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a device that is a combination of any 2 or more of the devices referred to in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a device of a class prescribed by regulation made under section 66 for the purposes of this definition;

subsection.def: surveillance product (監察成果) means any material obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization for covert surveillance, and includes a copy of the material;
telecommunications interception (電訊截取) means interception of any communication transmitted by a telecommunications system;
telecommunications service (電訊服務) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);
telecommunications system (電訊系統) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);
tracking device (追蹤器材) means any electronic device used to determine or monitor the location of any person or any object or the status of any object;
Type 1 surveillance (第1類監察) means any covert surveillance other than Type 2 surveillance;

def.name: Type2Surveillance
def.leadIn: Type 2 surveillance (第2類監察), subject to subsections (3) and (4), means any covert surveillance that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is carried out with the use of a listening device or an optical surveillance device by any person for the purpose of listening to, monitoring or recording words spoken or activity carried out by any other person, if the person using the device—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a person by whom the other person intends, or should reasonably expect, the words or activity to be heard or seen; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: listens to, monitors or records the words or activity with the consent, express or implied, of a person described in subparagraph (i); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is carried out with the use of an optical surveillance device or a tracking device, if the use of the device does not involve—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: entry onto any premises without permission; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: interference with the interior of any conveyance or object, or electronic interference with the device, without permission.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person is not regarded as being entitled to a reasonable expectation of privacy within the meaning of paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of covert surveillance in subsection (1) in relation to any activity carried out by him in a public place, but nothing in this subsection affects any such entitlement of the person in relation to words spoken, written or read by him in a public place.

For the purposes of this Ordinance, any covert surveillance which is Type 2 surveillance under the definition of Type 2 surveillance in subsection (1) is regarded as Type 1 surveillance if it is likely that any information which may be subject to legal professional privilege will be obtained by carrying it out.

An officer of a department may apply for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization for any Type 2 surveillance as if the Type 2 surveillance were Type 1 surveillance, and the provisions of this Ordinance relating to the application and the prescribed authorization apply to the Type 2 surveillance as if it were Type 1 surveillance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a communication transmitted by a postal service is regarded as being in the course of the transmission if it is regarded as being in course of transmission by post under section 2(2) of the Post Office Ordinance (Cap. 98); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a communication transmitted by a telecommunications system is not regarded as being in the course of the transmission if it has been received by the intended recipient of the communication or by an information system or facility under his control or to which he may have access, whether or not he has actually read or listened to the contents of the communication.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the contents of any communication transmitted by a telecommunications system include any data produced in association with the communication.

For the purposes of this Ordinance, advocacy, protest or dissent (whether in furtherance of a political or social objective or otherwise), unless likely to be carried on by violent means, is not of itself regarded as a threat to public security.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application is regarded as being made orally if it is made orally in person or made by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means by which words spoken can be heard (whether or not any part of the application is made in writing);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information is regarded as being provided orally if it is provided orally in person or provided by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means by which words spoken can be heard (whether or not any part of the information is provided in writing); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a determination (including the issue of a prescribed authorization or a renewed prescribed authorization and the giving of any reason) is regarded as being delivered orally if it is delivered orally in person or delivered by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means by which words spoken can be heard (whether or not any part of the determination is delivered in writing).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Conditions for issue, renewal or continuance of prescribed authorization

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, the conditions for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization, or the continuance of a prescribed authorization or a part of a prescribed authorization, are that, in the circumstances of the particular case— (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned is that of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: preventing or detecting serious crime; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: protecting public security;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there is reasonable suspicion that any person has been, is, or is likely to be, involved in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance is that specified in paragraph (a)(i), the particular serious crime to be prevented or detected; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance is that specified in paragraph (a)(ii), any activity which constitutes or would constitute the particular threat to public security; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the interception or covert surveillance is necessary for, and proportionate to, the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying it out, upon—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: balancing the relevant factors against the intrusiveness of the interception or covert surveillance on any person who is to be the subject of or may be affected by the interception or covert surveillance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: considering whether the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance can reasonably be furthered by other less intrusive means; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: considering such other matters that are relevant in the circumstances.

def.name: RelevantFactors
def.leadIn: In this section, relevant factors (有關因素) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the immediacy and gravity of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned is that specified in subsection (1)(a)(i), the particular serious crime to be prevented or detected; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned is that specified in subsection (1)(a)(ii), the particular threat to public security; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the likely value and relevance, in relation to the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance, of the information likely to be obtained by carrying it out.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Prohibition on Interception and Covert Surveillance

section.name: s4
section.heading: Prohibition on interception

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no public officer shall, directly or indirectly (whether through any other person or otherwise), carry out any interception.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any interception carried out pursuant to a prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interception of telecommunications transmitted by radiocommunications (other than the radiocommunications part of a telecommunications network for the provision of a public telecommunications service by any carrier licensee under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106)); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any interception authorized, permitted or required to be carried out by or under any enactment other than this Ordinance (including any interception carried out in the course of the execution of an order of a court authorizing the search of any premises or the seizure of any evidence).

subsection.def: In this section, carrier licensee (傳送者牌照持有人), public telecommunications service (公共電訊服務), radiocommunications (無線電通訊), telecommunications (電訊) and telecommunications network (電訊網絡) have the meanings respectively assigned to them by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Prohibition on covert surveillance

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no public officer shall, directly or indirectly (whether through any other person or otherwise), carry out any covert surveillance.
Subsection (1) does not apply to any covert surveillance carried out pursuant to a prescribed authorization.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Panel judges

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall, on the recommendation of the Chief Justice, appoint 3 to 6 eligible judges to be panel judges for the purposes of this Ordinance.
A panel judge shall be appointed for a period of 3 years.
The Chief Executive may, on the recommendation of the Chief Justice, revoke the appointment of a panel judge for good cause.

subsection.leadIn: In performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, a panel judge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not regarded as a court or a member of a court; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the same powers, protection and immunities as a judge of the Court of First Instance has in relation to proceedings in that Court.

subsection.content: Schedule 2 applies to and in relation to the procedures of, and other matters relating to, a panel judge.
A person previously appointed as a panel judge may from time to time be further appointed as such in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance that apply to the appointment of a panel judge.

subsection.def: In this section, eligible judge (合資格法官) means a judge of the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Authorizing officers
section.content: The head of a department may designate any officer not below a rank equivalent to that of senior superintendent of police to be an authorizing officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Application for judge’s authorization for interception or Type 1 surveillance

subsection.content: An officer of a department may apply to a panel judge for the issue of a judge’s authorization for any interception or Type 1 surveillance to be carried out by or on behalf of any of the officers of the department.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be supported by an affidavit of the applicant which is to comply with the requirements specified in Part 1 or 2 of Schedule 3 (as may be applicable).

subsection.content: An application may not be made under subsection (1) unless the making of the application has been approved by a directorate officer of the department concerned.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Determination of application for judge’s authorization

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for the issue of a judge’s authorization made under section 8, the panel judge may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue the judge’s authorization sought under the application, with or without variations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to issue the judge’s authorization.

subsection.content: The panel judge shall not issue the judge’s authorization unless he is satisfied that the conditions for its issue under section 3 have been met.

subsection.leadIn: The panel judge shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the judge’s authorization in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal in writing.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Duration of judge’s authorization

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time specified by the panel judge when issuing the judge’s authorization, which in any case is not to be earlier than the time when it is issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to any renewal under this Division, ceases to have effect upon the expiration of the period specified by the panel judge when issuing the judge’s authorization, which in any case is not to be longer than the period of 3 months beginning with the time when it takes effect.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application for renewal of judge’s authorization

subsection.content: At any time before a judge’s authorization ceases to have effect, an officer of the department concerned may apply to a panel judge for the renewal of the judge’s authorization.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be supported by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the judge’s authorization sought to be renewed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: copies of all affidavits provided under this Part for the purposes of any application for the issue or renewal of the judge’s authorization, or for the purposes of any application made further to an oral application for confirmation of the judge’s authorization or its previous renewal; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an affidavit of the applicant which is to comply with the requirements specified in Part 4 of Schedule 3.

subsection.content: An application may not be made under subsection (1) unless the making of the application has been approved by a directorate officer of the department concerned.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Determination of application for renewal of judge’s authorization

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for the renewal of a judge’s authorization made under section 11, the panel judge may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant the renewal sought under the application, with or without variations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to grant the renewal.

subsection.leadIn: The panel judge shall not grant the renewal unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is satisfied that the conditions for the renewal under section 3 have been met; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), he has taken into consideration the period for which the judge’s authorization has had effect since its first issue.

subsection.leadIn: The panel judge shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the renewed judge’s authorization in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal in writing.

subsection.content: A judge’s authorization may be renewed more than once under this Ordinance.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Duration of renewal of judge’s authorization
section.leadIn: A renewal of a judge’s authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time when the judge’s authorization would have ceased to have effect but for the renewal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to any further renewal under this Division, ceases to have effect upon the expiration of the period specified by the panel judge when granting the renewal, which in any case is not to be longer than the period of 3 months beginning with the time when it takes effect.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Application for executive authorization for Type 2 surveillance

subsection.content: An officer of a department may apply to an authorizing officer of the department for the issue of an executive authorization for any Type 2 surveillance to be carried out by or on behalf of any of the officers of the department.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be supported by a statement in writing made by the applicant which is to comply with the requirements specified in Part 3 of Schedule 3.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Determination of application for executive authorization

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for the issue of an executive authorization made under section 14, the authorizing officer may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue the executive authorization sought under the application, with or without variations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to issue the executive authorization.

subsection.content: The authorizing officer shall not issue the executive authorization unless he is satisfied that the conditions for its issue under section 3 have been met.

subsection.leadIn: The authorizing officer shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the executive authorization in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal in writing.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Duration of executive authorization

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time specified by the authorizing officer when issuing the executive authorization, which in any case is not to be earlier than the time when it is issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to any renewal under this Division, ceases to have effect upon the expiration of the period specified by the authorizing officer when issuing the executive authorization, which in any case is not to be longer than the period of 3 months beginning with the time when it takes effect.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Application for renewal of executive authorization

subsection.content: At any time before an executive authorization ceases to have effect, an officer of the department concerned may apply to an authorizing officer of the department for the renewal of the executive authorization.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be supported by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the executive authorization sought to be renewed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: copies of all statements provided under this Part for the purposes of any application for the issue or renewal of the executive authorization, or for the purposes of any application made further to an oral application for confirmation of the executive authorization or its previous renewal; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a statement in writing made by the applicant which is to comply with the requirements specified in Part 4 of Schedule 3.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Determination of application for renewal of executive authorization

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for the renewal of an executive authorization made under section 17, the authorizing officer may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant the renewal sought under the application, with or without variations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to grant the renewal.

subsection.leadIn: The authorizing officer shall not grant the renewal unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is satisfied that the conditions for the renewal under section 3 have been met; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), he has taken into consideration the period for which the executive authorization has had effect since its first issue.

subsection.leadIn: The authorizing officer shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the renewed executive authorization in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal in writing.

subsection.content: An executive authorization may be renewed more than once under this Ordinance.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Duration of renewal of executive authorization
section.leadIn: A renewal of an executive authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time when the executive authorization would have ceased to have effect but for the renewal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to any further renewal under this Division, ceases to have effect upon the expiration of the period specified by the authorizing officer when granting the renewal, which in any case is not to be longer than the period of 3 months beginning with the time when it takes effect.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Emergency Authorizations

section.name: s20
section.heading: Application for emergency authorization for interception or Type 1 surveillance in case of emergency

subsection.leadIn: An officer of a department may apply to the head of the department for the issue of an emergency authorization for any interception or Type 1 surveillance to be carried out by or on behalf of any of the officers of the department, if he considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: there is immediate need for the interception or Type 1 surveillance to be carried out by reason of an imminent risk of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: death or serious bodily harm of any person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: substantial damage to property;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: serious threat to public security; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: loss of vital evidence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances of the case, it is not reasonably practicable to apply for the issue of a judge’s authorization for the interception or Type 1 surveillance.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be supported by a statement in writing made by the applicant which is to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: set out the reason for making the application; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: comply with the requirements specified in Part 1 or 2 of Schedule 3 (as may be applicable) which are to apply to the statement as they apply to an affidavit referred to in section 8(2)(b).

section.name: s21
section.heading: Determination of application for emergency authorization

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for the issue of an emergency authorization made under section 20, the head of the department concerned may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue the emergency authorization sought under the application, with or without variations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to issue the emergency authorization.

subsection.leadIn: The head of the department shall not issue the emergency authorization unless he is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that section 20(1)(a) and (b) applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the conditions for the issue of the emergency authorization under section 3 have been met.

subsection.leadIn: The head of the department shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the emergency authorization in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal in writing.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Duration of emergency authorization

subsection.leadIn: An emergency authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time specified by the head of the department concerned when issuing the emergency authorization, which in any case is not to be earlier than the time when it is issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to have effect upon the expiration of the period specified by the head of the department when issuing the emergency authorization, which in any case is not to be longer than the period of 48 hours beginning with the time when it is issued.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to any application under section 8 for the issue of any judge’s authorization for the interception or Type 1 surveillance concerned, an emergency authorization may not be renewed under this Ordinance.

division.crossHeading: Application for confirmation of emergency authorizations

section.name: s23
section.heading: Application for confirmation of emergency authorization

subsection.content: Where any interception or Type 1 surveillance is carried out pursuant to an emergency authorization, the head of the department concerned shall cause an officer of the department to apply to a panel judge for confirmation of the emergency authorization, as soon as reasonably practicable after, and in any event within the period of 48 hours beginning with, the time when the emergency authorization is issued.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be supported by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the emergency authorization; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an affidavit of the applicant which is to verify the contents of the statement provided under section 20(2)(b) for the purposes of the application for the issue of the emergency authorization.

subsection.leadIn: In default of any application being made for confirmation of the emergency authorization within the period of 48 hours referred to in subsection (1), the head of the department concerned shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause the immediate destruction of any information obtained by carrying out the interception or Type 1 surveillance concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 54, submit to the Commissioner a report with details of the case.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Determination of application for confirmation of emergency authorization

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for confirmation of an emergency authorization as provided for in section 23(1), the panel judge may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm the emergency authorization; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to confirm the emergency authorization.

subsection.content: The panel judge shall not confirm the emergency authorization unless he is satisfied that section 21(2)(b) has been complied with in the issue of the emergency authorization.

subsection.leadIn: Where the panel judge refuses to confirm the emergency authorization under subsection (1)(b), he may make one or more of the following orders—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in any case where the emergency authorization still has effect at the time of the determination, an order that the emergency authorization is, notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be revoked upon the making of the determination; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: only to have effect subject to the variations, and any new conditions, specified by him, from the time of the determination; (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any case whether or not the emergency authorization still has effect at the time of the determination, an order that the head of the department concerned shall cause the immediate destruction of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), any information obtained by carrying out the interception or Type 1 surveillance concerned; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where paragraph (a)(ii) applies, any information obtained by carrying out the interception or Type 1 surveillance concerned that is specified in the order.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The new conditions specified by the panel judge under subsection (3)(a)(ii) may apply to the emergency authorization itself or to any further authorization or requirement under it (whether granted or imposed under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance). (Added 21 of 2016 s. 6)
Where the emergency authorization is revoked under subsection (3)(a)(i), the emergency authorization is, notwithstanding section 22(1)(b), to cease to have effect from the time of the revocation.

subsection.leadIn: The panel judge shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), endorsing his confirmation on the emergency authorization in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal and making any order under subsection (3) in writing.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Special Provisions for Oral Applications

section.name: s25
section.heading: Oral application and its effect

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the relevant written application provision, an application for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization under this Ordinance may be made orally, if the applicant considers that, having regard to all the circumstances of the case, it is not reasonably practicable to make the application in accordance with the relevant written application provision.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding the relevant determination provision and without prejudice to the relevant conditions provision, where an oral application is made, the relevant authority shall not issue or grant the prescribed authorization or renewal sought under the application unless he is satisfied that, having regard to all the circumstances of the case, it is not reasonably practicable to make the application in accordance with the relevant written application provision.

Notwithstanding the relevant document provision, where an oral application is made, the information required to be provided for the purposes of the application under the relevant document provision may be provided orally (and accordingly any requirement as to the making of any affidavit or statement does not apply).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the relevant written determination provision, where an oral application is made, the relevant authority may deliver the determination required to be delivered in respect of the application under the relevant determination provision by—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: issuing the prescribed authorization or the renewed prescribed authorization orally; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: where he refuses to issue or grant the prescribed authorization or renewal sought under the application, giving the reason for the refusal orally.

subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Division, any oral application and any prescribed authorization or renewal issued or granted as a result of that application are for all purposes regarded as having the same effect respectively as an application made in writing and a prescribed authorization or renewal issued or granted as a result of that application, and the provisions of this Ordinance are, subject to necessary modifications, to apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant conditions provision (有關條件條文) means section 9(2), 12(2), 15(2), 18(2) or 21(2) (as may be applicable);
relevant determination provision (有關決定條文) means section 9(1), 12(1), 15(1), 18(1) or 21(1) (as may be applicable);
relevant document provision (有關文件條文) means section 8(2)(b), 11(2)(b), 14(2)(b), 17(2)(b) or 20(2)(b) (as may be applicable);
relevant written application provision (有關書面申請條文) means section 8(2)(a), 11(2)(a), 14(2)(a), 17(2)(a) or 20(2)(a) (as may be applicable);
relevant written determination provision (有關書面決定條文) means section 9(3), 12(3), 15(3), 18(3) or 21(3) (as may be applicable).

division.crossHeading: Application for confirmation of prescribed authorizations or renewals issued or granted upon oral applications

section.name: s26
section.heading: Application for confirmation of prescribed authorization or renewal issued or granted upon oral application

subsection.content: Where, as a result of an oral application, the prescribed authorization or renewal sought under the application has been issued or granted, the head of the department concerned shall cause an officer of the department to apply to the relevant authority for confirmation of the prescribed authorization or renewal, as soon as reasonably practicable after, and in any event within the period of 48 hours beginning with, the time when the prescribed authorization or renewal is issued or granted.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be supported by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a record in writing containing all the information that would have been provided to the relevant authority in writing under the relevant written application provision had the oral application been made in writing;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where section 25(3) applies in relation to the oral application—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the relevant authority is a panel judge, an affidavit of the applicant which is to verify all the information provided pursuant to that section for the purposes of the oral application; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the relevant authority is not a panel judge, a statement in writing made by the applicant setting out all the information provided pursuant to that section for the purposes of the oral application; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where section 25(4) applies in relation to the oral application, a record in writing setting out the determination delivered pursuant to that section in respect of the oral application.

subsection.leadIn: In default of any application being made for confirmation of the prescribed authorization or renewal within the period of 48 hours referred to in subsection (1), then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any case where the prescribed authorization or renewal still has effect upon the expiration of the period, the prescribed authorization or renewal is, notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance, to be regarded as revoked upon the expiration of the period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any case whether or not the prescribed authorization or renewal still has effect upon the expiration of the period, the head of the department concerned shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cause the immediate destruction of any information obtained by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: without prejudice to section 54, submit to the Commissioner a report with details of the case.

subsection.content: Where the prescribed authorization or renewal is regarded as revoked under subsection (3)(a), the prescribed authorization or renewal is, notwithstanding the relevant duration provision, to cease to have effect from the time of the revocation.

subsection.leadIn: If, at the time of an application for confirmation of the prescribed authorization or renewal as provided for in subsection (1), the relevant authority is no longer holding his office or performing the relevant functions of his office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 54 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the reference to relevant authority in that subsection includes the person for the time being appointed as a panel judge or authorizing officer (as the case may be) and lawfully performing the relevant functions of the office of that relevant authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this section and section 27 are to apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant duration provision (有關時限條文) means section 10(b), 13(b), 16(b) or 19(b) (as may be applicable);
relevant written application provision (有關書面申請條文) means section 8(2)(a), 11(2)(a), 14(2)(a), 17(2)(a) or 20(2)(a) (as may be applicable).

section.name: s27
section.heading: Determination of application for confirmation of prescribed authorization or renewal issued or granted upon oral application

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for confirmation of a prescribed authorization or renewal as provided for in section 26(1), the relevant authority may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm the prescribed authorization or renewal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to confirm the prescribed authorization or renewal.

subsection.content: The relevant authority shall not confirm the prescribed authorization or renewal unless he is satisfied that the relevant conditions provision has been complied with in the issue or grant of the prescribed authorization or renewal.

subsection.leadIn: Where the relevant authority refuses to confirm the prescribed authorization or renewal under subsection (1)(b), he may make one or more of the following orders—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in any case where the prescribed authorization or renewal still has effect at the time of the determination, an order that the prescribed authorization or renewal is, notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be revoked upon the making of the determination; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: only to have effect subject to the variations, and any new conditions, specified by him, from the time of the determination; (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any case whether or not the prescribed authorization or renewal still has effect at the time of the determination, an order that the head of the department concerned shall cause the immediate destruction of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), any information obtained by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where paragraph (a)(ii) applies, any information obtained by carrying out the interception or covert surveillance concerned that is specified in the order.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The new conditions specified by the relevant authority under subsection (3)(a)(ii) may apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the prescribed authorization or renewed prescribed authorization itself; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any further authorization or requirement under the prescribed authorization or renewed prescribed authorization (whether granted or imposed under the terms of the prescribed authorization or renewed prescribed authorization or any provision of this Ordinance). (Added 21 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.content: Where the prescribed authorization or renewal is revoked under subsection (3)(a)(i), the prescribed authorization or renewal is, notwithstanding the relevant duration provision, to cease to have effect from the time of the revocation.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant authority shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the prescribed authorization or the renewed prescribed authorization (being the prescribed authorization confirmed under that subsection or being in terms of the renewal confirmed under that subsection (as the case may be)) in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal and making any order under subsection (3) in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant conditions provision (有關條件條文) means section 9(2), 12(2), 15(2), 18(2) or 21(2)(b) (as may be applicable);
relevant duration provision (有關時限條文) means section 10(b), 13(b), 16(b), 19(b) or 22(1)(b) (as may be applicable).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Special case of emergency authorization issued as a result of oral application

subsection.leadIn: Where an emergency authorization is issued as a result of an oral application, sections 26 and 27 do not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for confirmation of the emergency authorization as provided for in section 23(1) has been made to a panel judge within the period of 48 hours referred to in that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the application is supported by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a record referred to in section 26(2)(b)(i);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an affidavit of the applicant which is to verify the contents of the statement provided under section 20(2)(b) for the purposes of the application for the issue of the emergency authorization or, where section 25(3) applies in relation to the oral application, all the information provided pursuant to section 25(3) for the purposes of the oral application; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the emergency authorization or, where section 25(4) applies in relation to the oral application, a record in writing setting out the determination delivered pursuant to that section in respect of the oral application.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 23(2)(b), the application described in subsection (1)(a) and (b) is for all purposes regarded as an application duly made for confirmation of the emergency authorization as provided for in section 23(1), and the provisions of this Ordinance are to apply accordingly (subject to section 24(5)(a) being read as requiring the panel judge to deliver his determination under section 24(1) by issuing the emergency authorization (being the emergency authorization confirmed under section 24(1)(a)) in writing).

division.name: D6
division.heading: General Provisions for Prescribed Authorizations
division.crossHeading: Matters authorized, required or provided for by prescribed authorizations

section.name: s29
section.heading: What a prescribed authorization may authorize or require under or by virtue of its terms, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed authorization for interception may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a postal interception, contain terms that authorize one or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the interception of communications made to or by any person specified in the prescribed authorization (whether by name or by description); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a telecommunications interception, contain terms that authorize one or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the interception of communications made to or from any telecommunications service that any person specified in the prescribed authorization (whether by name or by description) is using, or is reasonably expected to use.

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed authorization for covert surveillance may contain terms that authorize one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of any surveillance devices in or on any premises specified in the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the use of any surveillance devices in respect of the conversations, activities or location of any person specified in the prescribed authorization (whether by name or by description).

subsection.content: A prescribed authorization, other than an executive authorization, may contain terms that authorize the doing of anything reasonably necessary to conceal any conduct authorized or required to be carried out under the prescribed authorization.

A prescribed authorization, other than an executive authorization, may, if it is reasonably necessary for the execution of the prescribed authorization, contain terms that authorize the interference with any property (whether or not of any person who is the subject of the interception or covert surveillance concerned).

A prescribed authorization, other than an executive authorization, may contain terms that require any person specified in the prescribed authorization (whether by name or by description), on being shown a copy of the prescribed authorization, to provide to any of the officers of the department concerned such reasonable assistance for the execution of the prescribed authorization as is specified in the prescribed authorization.

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed authorization for interception also authorizes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the installation, use and maintenance of any devices required to be used in order to intercept any of the communications authorized to be intercepted under the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the entry, by the use of reasonable force if necessary, onto any premises in order to carry out any conduct authorized or required to be carried out under the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the incidental interception of any communication which necessarily arises from the interception of communications authorized to be carried out under the prescribed authorization; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: where subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii) is applicable, the provision to any person, for the execution of the prescribed authorization, of particulars of the addresses, numbers, apparatus or other factors, or combination of factors, that are to be used for identifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a)(ii), the communications made to or by the person specified in the prescribed authorization; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(ii), the communications made to or from any telecommunications service that the person specified in the prescribed authorization is using, or is reasonably expected to use.

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed authorization for covert surveillance also authorizes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where subsection (2)(a) is applicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the installation, use and maintenance of any of the surveillance devices authorized to be used under the prescribed authorization in or on the premises specified in the prescribed authorization; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of Type 1 surveillance, the entry, by the use of reasonable force if necessary, onto the premises, and onto any other premises adjoining or providing access to the premises, in order to carry out any conduct authorized or required to be carried out under the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where subsection (2)(b) is applicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the installation, use and maintenance of any of the surveillance devices authorized to be used under the prescribed authorization in or on the object, or an object of the class, specified in the prescribed authorization; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of Type 1 surveillance, the entry, by the use of reasonable force if necessary, onto any premises where the object, or an object of the class, is reasonably believed to be or likely to be, and onto any other premises adjoining or providing access to the premises, in order to carry out any conduct authorized or required to be carried out under the prescribed authorization; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where subsection (2)(c) is applicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the installation, use and maintenance of any of the surveillance devices authorized to be used under the prescribed authorization in or on any premises where the person specified in the prescribed authorization is reasonably believed to be or likely to be; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of Type 1 surveillance, the entry, by the use of reasonable force if necessary, onto the premises, and onto any other premises adjoining or providing access to the premises, in order to carry out any conduct authorized or required to be carried out under the prescribed authorization.

section.name: s30
section.heading: What a prescribed authorization also authorizes
section.leadIn: A prescribed authorization also authorizes the undertaking of conduct, including the following conduct, that is necessary for and incidental to the carrying out of what is authorized or required to be carried out under the prescribed authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the retrieval of any of the devices authorized to be used under the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the installation, use, maintenance and retrieval of any enhancement equipment for the devices;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the temporary removal of any conveyance or object from any premises for the installation, maintenance or retrieval of the devices or enhancement equipment and the return of the conveyance or object to the premises;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the breaking open of anything for the installation, maintenance or retrieval of the devices or enhancement equipment;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the connection of the devices or enhancement equipment to any source of electricity and the use of electricity from that source to operate the devices or enhancement equipment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the connection of the devices or enhancement equipment to any object or system that may be used to transmit information in any form and the use of that object or system in connection with the operation of the devices or enhancement equipment; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the provision of assistance for the execution of the prescribed authorization.

section.name: s31
section.heading: What a prescribed authorization may not authorize

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this Ordinance, unless exceptional circumstances exist—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: no prescribed authorization may contain terms that authorize the interception of communications by reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a postal interception, an office or other relevant premises, or a residence, of a lawyer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a telecommunications interception, any telecommunications service used at an office or other relevant premises, or a residence, of a lawyer, or any telecommunications service known or reasonably expected to be known by the applicant to be ordinarily used by a lawyer for the purpose of providing legal advice to clients; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no prescribed authorization may contain terms that authorize any covert surveillance to be carried out in respect of oral or written communications taking place at an office or other relevant premises, or a residence, of a lawyer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), exceptional circumstances exist if the relevant authority is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the lawyer concerned;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an office or other relevant premises of the lawyer, any other lawyer practising with him or any other person working in the office; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a residence of the lawyer, any other person residing in the residence,

paragraph.continued: is a party to any activity which constitutes or would constitute a serious crime or a threat to public security; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any of the communications concerned is for the furtherance of a criminal purpose.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, a prescribed authorization does not authorize any device to be implanted in, or administered to, a person without the consent of the person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: lawyer (律師) means a barrister, solicitor or foreign lawyer as defined in section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) who practises as such, or any person holding an appointment under section 3(1) of the Legal Aid Ordinance (Cap. 91);

other relevant premises (其他有關處所), in relation to a lawyer, means any premises, other than an office of the lawyer, that are known or reasonably expected to be known by the applicant to be ordinarily used by the lawyer and by other lawyers for the purpose of providing legal advice to clients (including any premises ordinarily used by lawyers for the purpose of providing legal advice to clients when in court or visiting a prison, police station or other place where any person is detained).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Prescribed authorization may be issued or renewed subject to conditions
section.content: A prescribed authorization may be issued or renewed subject to any conditions specified in it that apply to the prescribed authorization itself or to any further authorization or requirement under it (whether granted or imposed under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance).

division.crossHeading: Device retrieval warrants after prescribed authorizations having ceased to have effect

section.name: s33
section.heading: Application for device retrieval warrant

subsection.leadIn: Where a prescribed authorization has in any way ceased to have effect under this Ordinance, an officer of the department concerned may apply to a panel judge for the issue of a device retrieval warrant authorizing the retrieval of any of the devices authorized to be used under the prescribed authorization if such devices—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been installed in or on any premises or object, pursuant to the prescribed authorization; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are still in or on such premises or object, or are in or on any other premises or object.

subsection.leadIn: The application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be supported by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the prescribed authorization; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an affidavit of the applicant which is to comply with the requirements specified in Schedule 4.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Determination of application for device retrieval warrant

subsection.leadIn: Upon considering an application for the issue of a device retrieval warrant made under section 33, the panel judge may, subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue the device retrieval warrant sought under the application, with or without variations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to issue the device retrieval warrant.

subsection.content: The panel judge shall not issue the device retrieval warrant unless he is satisfied that section 33(1)(a) and (b) applies to the devices concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The panel judge shall deliver his determination under subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), issuing the device retrieval warrant in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), giving the reason for the refusal in writing.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Duration of device retrieval warrant

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect at the time specified by the panel judge when issuing the warrant, which in any case is not to be earlier than the time when it is issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to have effect upon the expiration of the period specified by the panel judge when issuing the warrant, which in any case is not to be longer than the period of 3 months beginning with the time when it takes effect.

section.name: s36
section.heading: What a device retrieval warrant may authorize under or by virtue of its terms, etc.

subsection.content: A device retrieval warrant may authorize the retrieval of any devices specified in the warrant.
A device retrieval warrant may contain terms that authorize the doing of anything reasonably necessary to conceal any conduct authorized to be carried out under the warrant.

A device retrieval warrant may, if it is reasonably necessary for the execution of the warrant, contain terms that authorize the interference with any property (whether or not of any person who is the subject of the interception or covert surveillance concerned).

section.name: s37
section.heading: What a device retrieval warrant also authorizes

subsection.leadIn: A device retrieval warrant also authorizes the undertaking of conduct, including the following conduct, that is necessary for and incidental to the carrying out of what is authorized to be carried out under the warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the retrieval of any enhancement equipment for the devices authorized to be retrieved under the warrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the entry, by the use of reasonable force if necessary, onto any premises where the devices or enhancement equipment is reasonably believed to be or likely to be, and onto any other premises adjoining or providing access to the premises, in order to retrieve the devices or enhancement equipment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the temporary removal of any conveyance or object from any premises for the retrieval of the devices or enhancement equipment and the return of the conveyance or object to the premises;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the breaking open of anything for the retrieval of the devices or enhancement equipment; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the provision of assistance for the execution of the warrant.

subsection.content: A device retrieval warrant which authorizes the retrieval of any tracking devices also authorizes the use of the tracking devices and any enhancement equipment for the tracking devices solely for the purposes of the location and retrieval of the tracking devices or enhancement equipment.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Device retrieval warrant may be issued subject to conditions
section.content: A device retrieval warrant may be issued subject to any conditions specified in it that apply to the warrant itself or to any further authorization under it (whether granted under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance).

section.name: s38A
section.heading: Report to panel judge: device retrieval warrant cannot be executed

subsection.leadIn: If, while a device retrieval warrant is in force but not yet completely executed, the officer of the department concerned who is for the time being in charge of the execution of the warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes aware that section 33(1)(a) or (b) does not apply to the devices or any of the devices specified in the warrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the opinion that the warrant or a part of the warrant cannot for whatever reason be executed,

subsection.continued: the officer must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming aware of the matter or forming the opinion, cause a report on the matter or opinion to be provided to a panel judge.

subsection.content: If a panel judge receives a report under subsection (1), the panel judge may revoke the device retrieval warrant concerned or the relevant part of the device retrieval warrant concerned.

If the device retrieval warrant or a part of the device retrieval warrant is revoked under subsection (2), the warrant or that part of the warrant, despite section 35(b), ceases to have effect from the time of the revocation.

subsection.leadIn: If the device retrieval warrant is not revoked or only part of the device retrieval warrant is revoked, the panel judge may do one or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary any terms or conditions in the warrant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any new conditions in the warrant that apply to the warrant itself or to any further authorization under it (whether granted under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance).

section.name: s39
section.heading: The Commissioner

subsection.content: There is hereby established an office by the name of the “Commissioner on Interception of Communications and Surveillance”. (Amended E.R. 7 of 2020)
The Chief Executive shall, on the recommendation of the Chief Justice, appoint an eligible judge to be the Commissioner.
The Commissioner shall be appointed for a period of 3 years.
The Commissioner shall be entitled to such remuneration and allowances as are determined by the Chief Executive.
The Chief Executive may, on the recommendation of the Chief Justice, revoke the appointment of the Commissioner for good cause.

A person previously appointed as the Commissioner may from time to time be further appointed as such in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance that apply to the appointment of the Commissioner.

def.name: EligibleJudge
def.leadIn: In this section, eligible judge (合資格法官) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a judge of the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a former permanent judge of the Court of Final Appeal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a former judge of the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Functions of Commissioner
section.leadIn: The functions of the Commissioner are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to oversee the compliance by departments and their officers with the relevant requirements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conduct reviews under Division 2;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: carry out examinations under Division 3;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: give notifications to relevant persons under Division 4;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: submit reports to the Chief Executive and make recommendations to the Secretary for Security and heads of departments under Division 5;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: perform any further functions prescribed by regulation made under section 66 for the purposes of this subparagraph; and

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: perform such other functions as are imposed or conferred on him under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Reviews on compliance with relevant requirements

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall conduct such reviews as he considers necessary on compliance by departments and their officers with the relevant requirements.
Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Commissioner shall conduct reviews on cases in respect of which a report has been submitted to him under section 23(3)(b), 26(3)(b)(ii) or 54.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the conduct of any review under subsection (1) or (2), the Commissioner shall record in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: details, as identified in the review, of any case of failure by any department or any of its officers to comply with any relevant requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other finding he has made in the review.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Notifications to departments concerned, etc.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall notify the head of any department concerned of his findings in a review under section 41(3).

On being notified of the findings of the Commissioner under subsection (1), the head of the department shall submit to the Commissioner a report with details of any measures taken by the department (including any disciplinary action taken in respect of any officer) to address any issues identified in the findings, as soon as reasonably practicable after the notification or, where the Commissioner has specified any period for submission of the report when giving the notification, within that period.
