Without prejudice to sections 49 and 50, the Commissioner may, whether before or after the head of the department has submitted a report to him under subsection (2), refer the findings and any other matters he thinks fit to the Chief Executive, the Secretary for Justice or any panel judge or any or all of them.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Application for examination

subsection.leadIn: A person may apply to the Commissioner for an examination under this Division, if he suspects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any communication transmitted to or by him has been intercepted by an officer of a department; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that he is the subject of any covert surveillance that has been carried out by an officer of a department.

subsection.content: The application is to be made in writing.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Examination by Commissioner

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner receives an application under section 43, he shall, subject to section 45, carry out an examination to determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the interception or covert surveillance alleged has taken place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if so, whether or not the interception or covert surveillance alleged has been carried out by an officer of a department without the authority of a prescribed authorization.

subsection.leadIn: If, on an examination, the Commissioner, having regard to section 46(1), determines that the interception or covert surveillance alleged has been carried out by an officer of a department without the authority of a prescribed authorization, he shall as soon as reasonably practicable give notice to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that he has found the case in the applicant’s favour and indicating whether the case is one of interception or covert surveillance, the date on which the interception or covert surveillance began and the duration of the interception or covert surveillance; and (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inviting the applicant to confirm whether the applicant wishes to seek an order for the payment of compensation under the application, and if so, to make written submissions to him for that purpose.

subsection.content: Upon receiving confirmation from the applicant that an order for the payment of compensation is sought, the Commissioner, upon taking into account any written submissions made to him for that purpose, may make any order for the payment of compensation by the Government to the applicant.
The compensation ordered to be paid under subsection (3) may include compensation for injury of feelings.

If, on an examination, the Commissioner makes a determination other than that referred to in subsection (2), he shall as soon as reasonably practicable give notice to the applicant stating that he has not found the case in the applicant’s favour.

Notwithstanding subsections (2), (3) and (5), the Commissioner shall only give a notice or make an order under those subsections when he considers that the giving of the notice or the making of the order (as the case may be) would not be prejudicial to the prevention or detection of crime or the protection of public security.
The Commissioner shall not make a determination referred to in subsection (2) in respect of an interception if the interception is within the description of section 4(2)(b) or (c).

section.name: s45
section.heading: Grounds for not carrying out examination, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where, before or in the course of an examination, the Commissioner considers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the application for the examination is received by the Commissioner more than 1 year after the day on which the interception or covert surveillance is alleged to have taken place or, where the interception or covert surveillance is alleged to have taken place on more than 1 day, the last occasion on which it is alleged to have taken place, and that it is not unfair for him not to carry out the examination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the application is made anonymously;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the applicant cannot, after the use of reasonable efforts, be identified or traced; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that, having regard to all the circumstances of the case, the application is frivolous or vexatious or is not made in good faith,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may refuse to carry out the examination or, where the examination has been commenced, to proceed with the carrying out of the examination (including the making of any determination further to the examination).

subsection.leadIn: Where, before or in the course of an examination, the Commissioner is satisfied that any relevant criminal proceedings are pending or are likely to be instituted, the Commissioner shall not carry out the examination or, where the examination has been commenced, proceed with the carrying out of the examination (including the making of any determination further to the examination)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of any pending criminal proceedings, until they have been finally determined or finally disposed of; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any criminal proceedings which are likely to be instituted, until they have been finally determined or finally disposed of or, if applicable, until they are no longer likely to be instituted.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), criminal proceedings are, in relation to an examination, regarded as relevant if, but only if, the interception or covert surveillance alleged in the application for the examination is or may be relevant to the determination of any question concerning any evidence which has been or may be adduced in those proceedings.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Further provisions relating to examinations

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an examination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in determining whether any interception or covert surveillance has been carried out without the authority of a prescribed authorization, the Commissioner shall apply the principles applicable by a court on an application for judicial review; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), the Commissioner may by applying those principles determine that any interception or covert surveillance has been carried out without the authority of a prescribed authorization notwithstanding the purported issue or renewal of any prescribed authorization.

subsection.content: Subject to section 53(1), the Commissioner shall carry out an examination on the basis of written submissions made to him.

Without prejudice to section 53(4), for the purposes of an examination, the applicant is not entitled to have access to any information, document or other matter (including any protected product, whether or not it contains any information that is or may be subject to legal professional privilege) compiled by, or made available to, the Commissioner in connection with the examination. (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 44(6), in giving notice to an applicant or making any order under section 44(2), (3) or (5), the Commissioner shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give reasons for his determination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give details of any interception or covert surveillance concerned further to those mentioned in section 44(2)(a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of section 44(5), indicate whether or not the interception or covert surveillance alleged has taken place.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Notifications to departments concerned, etc.

subsection.content: Where, on an examination, the Commissioner makes a determination referred to in section 44(2), he shall notify the head of the department concerned of the determination, including any order or findings he has made in the examination.

On being given the notification under subsection (1), the head of the department shall submit to the Commissioner a report with details of any measures taken by the department (including any disciplinary action taken in respect of any officer) to address any issues arising from the determination, as soon as reasonably practicable after the notification or, where the Commissioner has specified any period for submission of the report when giving the notification, within that period.

Without prejudice to sections 49 and 50, the Commissioner may, whether before or after the head of the department has submitted a report to him under subsection (2), refer the determination and any other matters he thinks fit to the Chief Executive, the Secretary for Justice or any panel judge or any or all of them.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Notifications to relevant persons

subsection.leadIn: If, in the course of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, the Commissioner, having regard to subsection (5), considers that there is any case in which any interception or covert surveillance has been carried out by an officer of a department without the authority of a prescribed authorization, subject to subsection (6), the Commissioner shall as soon as reasonably practicable give notice to the relevant person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that there has been such a case and indicating whether the case is one of interception or covert surveillance, the date on which the interception or covert surveillance began and the duration of the interception or covert surveillance; and (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: informing the relevant person of his right to apply to the Commissioner for an examination in respect of the interception or covert surveillance.

subsection.content: Where the relevant person makes an application for an examination in respect of the interception or covert surveillance within 6 months after receipt of the notice or within such further period as the Commissioner may allow, the Commissioner shall, notwithstanding anything in section 45(1)(a) but subject to the other provisions of section 45, make a determination referred to in section 44(2), and the provisions of this Ordinance are to apply accordingly.

Notwithstanding subsection (1), the Commissioner shall only give a notice under that subsection when he considers that the giving of the notice would not be prejudicial to the prevention or detection of crime or the protection of public security.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (3), in giving notice to a relevant person under subsection (1), the Commissioner shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give reasons for his findings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give details of any interception or covert surveillance concerned further to those mentioned in subsection (1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in considering whether any interception or covert surveillance has been carried out without the authority of a prescribed authorization, the Commissioner shall apply the principles applicable by a court on an application for judicial review; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), the Commissioner may by applying those principles determine that any interception or covert surveillance has been carried out without the authority of a prescribed authorization notwithstanding the purported issue or renewal of any prescribed authorization.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not require the Commissioner to give any notice to a relevant person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant person cannot, after the use of reasonable efforts, be identified or traced;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner considers that the intrusiveness of the interception or covert surveillance concerned on the relevant person is negligible; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of interception, the interception is within the description of section 4(2)(b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantPerson
def.leadIn: relevant person (有關人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the interception or covert surveillance concerned is one that is continued after the prescribed authorization concerned or the relevant part of the prescribed authorization concerned has ceased to have effect, the subject of the interception or covert surveillance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the interception or covert surveillance concerned is carried out by an officer of the department concerned purportedly pursuant to a prescribed authorization but the subject of the interception or covert surveillance is not the intended subject under the prescribed authorization, the subject of the interception or covert surveillance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the interception or covert surveillance concerned is carried out without the authority of a prescribed authorization, otherwise than in a situation specified in paragraph (a) or (b), the subject of the interception or covert surveillance. (Replaced 21 of 2016 s. 12)

section.name: s49
section.heading: Annual reports to Chief Executive by Commissioner

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall, for each report period, submit a report to the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: A report for a report period is to set out, separately in relation to interception and covert surveillance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a list showing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the respective numbers of judge’s authorizations, executive authorizations and emergency authorizations issued under this Ordinance during the report period, and the average duration of the respective prescribed authorizations;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the respective numbers of judge’s authorizations, executive authorizations and emergency authorizations issued as a result of an oral application under this Ordinance during the report period, and the average duration of the respective prescribed authorizations;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the respective numbers of judge’s authorizations and executive authorizations renewed as a result of an oral application under this Ordinance during the report period, and the average duration of the respective renewals;

subparagraph.name: v
vi
subparagraph.content: the respective numbers of applications for the issue of judge’s authorizations, executive authorizations and emergency authorizations made under this Ordinance that have been refused during the report period;

subparagraph.name: vii
viii
subparagraph.content: the respective numbers of oral applications for the issue of judge’s authorizations, executive authorizations and emergency authorizations made under this Ordinance that have been refused during the report period; and

subparagraph.name: ix

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a list showing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the major categories of offences for the investigation of which prescribed authorizations have been issued or renewed under this Ordinance during the report period; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a list showing—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a list showing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a summary of reviews conducted by the Commissioner under section 41 during the report period;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number and broad nature of any cases of irregularities or errors identified in the reviews during the report period;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of applications for examination that have been received by the Commissioner during the report period;

subparagraph.name: iv
v
subparagraph.content: the number of cases in which a notice has been given by the Commissioner under section 48 during the report period;

subparagraph.name: vi
vii
subparagraph.content: the number of cases in which information subject to legal professional privilege has been obtained in consequence of any interception or covert surveillance carried out pursuant to a prescribed authorization during the report period; and

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the number of cases in which disciplinary action has been taken in respect of any officer of a department according to any report submitted to the Commissioner under section 42, 47, 52 or 54 during the report period, and the broad nature of such action; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an assessment on the overall compliance with the relevant requirements during the report period.

subsection.content: The report is to be submitted within 6 months after the expiry of the report period.

The Chief Executive shall cause to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council a copy of the report, together with a statement as to whether any matter has been excluded from that copy under subsection (5) without the agreement of the Commissioner.

If the Chief Executive considers that the publication of any matter in the report referred to in subsection (4) would be prejudicial to the prevention or detection of crime or the protection of public security, he may, after consultation with the Commissioner, exclude such matter from the copy of the report to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council under that subsection.

def.name: ReportPeriod
def.leadIn: In this section, report period (報告期間), in relation to a report required to be submitted under subsection (1), means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period beginning on the commencement* of this Ordinance and ending on 31 December in the same year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the succeeding periods of 12 months ending on 31 December.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Other reports to Chief Executive by Commissioner
section.content: In addition to any report required to be submitted to the Chief Executive under section 49, the Commissioner may from time to time submit any further report to the Chief Executive on any matter relating to the performance of his functions under this Ordinance as he thinks fit.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Recommendations to Secretary for Security on code of practice

subsection.content: If, in the course of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, the Commissioner considers that any provision of the code of practice should be revised to better carry out the objects of this Ordinance, he may make such recommendations to the Secretary for Security as he thinks fit.

Where the Commissioner makes any recommendations to the Secretary for Security under subsection (1), the Secretary shall notify the Commissioner of any exercise of power by him under section 63(3) to implement the recommendations, as soon as reasonably practicable after the recommendations have been made or, where the Commissioner has specified any period for the issue of the notification when making the recommendations, within that period.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Recommendations to departments

subsection.content: If, in the course of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, the Commissioner considers that any arrangements made by any department should be changed to better carry out the objects of this Ordinance or the provisions of the code of practice, he may make such recommendations to the head of the department as he thinks fit.

Where the Commissioner makes any recommendations to the head of the department under subsection (1), the head of the department shall submit to the Commissioner a report with details of any measures taken by the department (including any disciplinary action taken in respect of any officer) to implement the recommendations, as soon as reasonably practicable after the recommendations have been made or, where the Commissioner has specified any period for submission of the report when making the recommendations, within that period.

Without prejudice to sections 49 and 50, the Commissioner may, whether before or after the head of the department has submitted a report to him under subsection (2), refer the recommendations and any other matters he thinks fit to the Chief Executive, the Secretary for Justice or any panel judge or any or all of them.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Further Provisions relating to Performance of Functions by Commissioner

section.name: s53
section.heading: Further powers of Commissioner

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require any public officer or any other person to answer any question, and to provide any information, document or other matter (including any protected product, whether or not it contains any information that is or may be subject to legal professional privilege) in his possession or control to the Commissioner, within the time and in the manner specified by the Commissioner when making the requirement; and (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require any officer of a department to prepare any report on any case of interception or covert surveillance handled by the department, or on any class of such cases, within the time and in the manner specified by the Commissioner when making the requirement.

subsection.content: For the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, the Commissioner may request a panel judge to provide him with access to any of the documents or records kept under section 3 of Schedule 2.
Notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance or any other law, any person on whom a requirement is imposed by the Commissioner under subsection (1) shall comply with the requirement.

Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, the Commissioner shall not be required to produce in any court or to divulge or communicate to any court, or to provide or disclose to any person, any information, document or other matter (including any protected product, whether or not it contains any information that is or may be subject to legal professional privilege) compiled by, or made available to, him in the course of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance. (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 13)
Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, the Commissioner may determine the procedure to be adopted in performing any of his functions under this Ordinance.

section.name: s53A
section.heading: Delegation of power to examine protected products

subsection.content: The Commissioner may delegate, in writing, the Commissioner’s power specified in subsection (2) to an officer working in the Commissioner’s office who is responsible to the Commissioner.
The power is the power to examine protected products provided to the Commissioner in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 53(1)(a).
The Commissioner may specify in any instrument of delegation any terms or conditions subject to which the delegation is to have effect.
A delegation under this section does not preclude the Commissioner from exercising at any time the power so delegated.

section.name: s54
section.heading: General obligations of departments to report on non-compliance

subsection.content: Without prejudice to other provisions of this Part, where the head of any department considers that there may have been any case of failure by the department or any of its officers to comply with any relevant requirement, he shall submit to the Commissioner a report with details of the case (including any disciplinary action taken in respect of any officer). (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting other provisions of this Part, if the head of any department considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there may have been a failure to comply with a relevant requirement in a case handled by the department; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure is not due to the fault of the department or any of its officers,

subsection.continued: the head must also submit to the Commissioner a report with details of the failure. (Added 21 of 2016 s. 15)

section.name: s55
section.heading: Commissioner not regarded as court
section.content: In performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, the Commissioner is for all purposes not regarded as a court or a member of a court.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Regular reviews

subsection.content: The head of each department shall make arrangements to keep under regular review the compliance by officers of the department with the relevant requirements.

Without prejudice to subsection (1), where the head of any department has made any designation under section 7, he shall make arrangements for officers of a rank higher than those held by the authorizing officers of the department to keep under regular review the performance by the authorizing officers of any function under this Ordinance.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Revocation of prescribed authorization following discontinuance of interception or covert surveillance

subsection.content: If the officer by whom any regular review is or has been conducted under section 56(1) or (2) is of the opinion that the ground for discontinuance of a prescribed authorization or a part of a prescribed authorization exists, he shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after forming the opinion, cause the interception or covert surveillance concerned or the relevant part of the interception or covert surveillance concerned to be discontinued.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), where a prescribed authorization has been issued or renewed under this Ordinance, the officer of the department concerned who is for the time being in charge of the interception or covert surveillance concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after he becomes aware that the ground for discontinuance of the prescribed authorization or a part of the prescribed authorization exists, cause the interception or covert surveillance or the relevant part of the interception or covert surveillance to be discontinued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may at any time cause the interception or covert surveillance or a part of the interception or covert surveillance to be discontinued.

subsection.content: Where any officer has caused any interception or covert surveillance to be discontinued, whether under subsection (1) or (2), he shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after the discontinuance, cause a report on the discontinuance and the ground for the discontinuance to be provided to the relevant authority to whom an application under this Ordinance for the issue or renewal of the prescribed authorization concerned has last been made.

Where the relevant authority receives a report under subsection (3), he shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving the report, revoke the prescribed authorization concerned or the relevant part of the prescribed authorization concerned.

Where the prescribed authorization or a part of the prescribed authorization is revoked under subsection (4), the prescribed authorization or that part of the prescribed authorization is, notwithstanding the relevant duration provision, to cease to have effect from the time of the revocation.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: If only part of the prescribed authorization is revoked, the relevant authority may do one or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary any terms or conditions in the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any new conditions in the prescribed authorization that apply to the prescribed authorization itself or to any further authorization or requirement under it (whether granted or imposed under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance). (Added 21 of 2016 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: If, at the time of the provision of a report to the relevant authority under subsection (3), the relevant authority is no longer holding his office or performing the relevant functions of his office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 54 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the reference to relevant authority in that subsection includes the person for the time being appointed as a panel judge or authorizing officer (as the case may be) and lawfully performing the relevant functions of the office of that relevant authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this section are to apply accordingly.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the ground for discontinuance of a prescribed authorization or a part of a prescribed authorization exists if the conditions for the continuance of the prescribed authorization or that part of the prescribed authorization under section 3 are not met.
In this section, relevant duration provision (有關時限條文) means section 10(b), 13(b), 16(b), 19(b) or 22(1)(b) (as may be applicable).

section.name: s58
section.heading: Report to relevant authority: arrest of subject of interception or covert surveillance

subsection.content: Where, further to the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization under this Ordinance, the officer of the department concerned who is for the time being in charge of the interception or covert surveillance concerned becomes aware that the subject of the interception or covert surveillance has been arrested, the officer shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after he becomes aware of the matter, cause to be provided to the relevant authority by whom the prescribed authorization has been issued or renewed a report assessing the effect of the arrest on the likelihood that any information which may be subject to legal professional privilege will be obtained by continuing the interception or covert surveillance.

Where the relevant authority receives a report under subsection (1), if the relevant authority considers that the conditions for the continuance of the prescribed authorization concerned or a part of the prescribed authorization concerned under section 3 are not met, the relevant authority must revoke the prescribed authorization or that part of the prescribed authorization. (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 17)

Where the prescribed authorization or a part of the prescribed authorization is revoked under subsection (2), the prescribed authorization or that part of the prescribed authorization is, notwithstanding the relevant duration provision, to cease to have effect from the time of the revocation. (Amended 21 of 2016 s. 17)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: If the prescribed authorization is not revoked or only part of the prescribed authorization is revoked, the relevant authority may do one or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary any terms or conditions in the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any new conditions in the prescribed authorization that apply to the prescribed authorization itself or to any further authorization or requirement under it (whether granted or imposed under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance). (Added 21 of 2016 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: If, at the time of the provision of a report to the relevant authority under subsection (1), the relevant authority is no longer holding his office or performing the relevant functions of his office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 54 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the reference to relevant authority in that subsection includes the person for the time being appointed as a panel judge or authorizing officer (as the case may be) and lawfully performing the relevant functions of the office of that relevant authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this section are to apply accordingly.

subsection.def: In this section, relevant duration provision (有關時限條文) means section 10(b), 13(b), 16(b), 19(b) or 22(1)(b) (as may be applicable).

section.name: s58A
section.heading: Report to relevant authority: inaccurate information or change in circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, while a prescribed authorization is in force, the officer of the department concerned who is for the time being in charge of the interception or covert surveillance concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: becomes aware that there is a material inaccuracy in the information provided for the purposes of—

subparagraph.content: the application for the issue of the prescribed authorization made under section 8, 14 or 20, including such an application made orally under section 25;
the application for the renewal of the prescribed authorization made under section 11 or 17, including such an application made orally under section 25;
the application for confirmation of the prescribed authorization as provided for in section 23(1) or 26(1); or
the application for confirmation of the renewal of the prescribed authorization as provided for in section 26(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: becomes aware that there has been a material change in the circumstances on the basis of which—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed authorization was issued under section 9(1)(a), 15(1)(a), 21(1)(a) or 25(4)(a);
the prescribed authorization was renewed under section 12(1)(a), 18(1)(a) or 25(4)(a);
the prescribed authorization was confirmed under section 24(1)(a) or 27(1)(a) or ordered to have effect under section 24(3)(a)(ii) or 27(3)(a)(ii); or
the renewal of the prescribed authorization was confirmed under section 27(1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming aware of the matter described in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (b)(i), cause a report on the matter to be provided to the relevant authority by whom the prescribed authorization has been issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming aware of the matter described in subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii), cause a report on the matter to be provided to the relevant authority by whom the prescribed authorization has been renewed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming aware of the matter described in subsection (1)(a)(iii) or (b)(iii), cause a report on the matter to be provided to the relevant authority by whom the prescribed authorization has been confirmed or ordered to have effect; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming aware of the matter described in subsection (1)(a)(iv) or (b)(iv), cause a report on the matter to be provided to the relevant authority by whom the renewal of the prescribed authorization has been confirmed.

subsection.leadIn: The officer is not required to cause a report on a material change in circumstances to be provided to the relevant authority under subsection (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the change arises from a discontinuance of the interception or covert surveillance concerned or a part of the interception or covert surveillance concerned under section 57(1) or (2) and a report has been provided to the relevant authority under section 57(3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the change arises from the arrest of the subject of the interception or covert surveillance concerned as referred to in section 58(1) and a report has been provided to the relevant authority under that section.

subsection.content: Where the relevant authority receives a report under subsection (2), if the relevant authority considers that the conditions for the continuance of the prescribed authorization concerned or a part of the prescribed authorization concerned under section 3 are not met, the relevant authority must revoke the prescribed authorization or that part of the prescribed authorization.

If the prescribed authorization or a part of the prescribed authorization is revoked under subsection (4), the prescribed authorization or that part of the prescribed authorization, despite the relevant duration provision, ceases to have effect from the time of the revocation.

subsection.leadIn: If the prescribed authorization is not revoked or only part of the prescribed authorization is revoked, the relevant authority may do one or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary any terms or conditions in the prescribed authorization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any new conditions in the prescribed authorization that apply to the prescribed authorization itself or to any further authorization or requirement under it (whether granted or imposed under its terms or any provision of this Ordinance).

subsection.leadIn: If, at the time of the provision of a report to the relevant authority under subsection (2), the relevant authority is no longer holding his or her office or performing the relevant functions of that office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without affecting section 54 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the reference to relevant authority in that subsection includes the person for the time being appointed as a panel judge or authorizing officer (as appropriate) and lawfully performing the relevant functions of the office of that relevant authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this section are to apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant duration provision (有關時限條文) means section 10(b), 13(b), 16(b), 19(b) or 22(1)(b) (as may be applicable).

section.name: s59
section.heading: Safeguards for protected products

subsection.leadIn: Where any protected product has been obtained pursuant to any prescribed authorization issued or renewed under this Ordinance on an application by any officer of a department, the head of the department shall make arrangements to ensure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the following are limited to the minimum that is necessary for the relevant purpose of the prescribed authorization—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the extent to which the protected product is disclosed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of persons to whom any of the protected product is disclosed;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the extent to which the protected product is copied; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the number of copies made of any of the protected product;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that all practicable steps are taken to ensure that the protected product is protected against unauthorized or accidental access, processing, erasure or other use; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that, except as otherwise provided in subsection (1A), the protected product—

subparagraph.content: is destroyed as soon as its retention is not necessary for the relevant purpose of the prescribed authorization, unless it is to be or has been provided to the Commissioner in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 53(1)(a) before it is so destroyed; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if it has been provided to the Commissioner in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 53(1)(a), is, after it is no longer required by the Commissioner, destroyed as soon as its retention is not necessary—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the relevant purpose of the prescribed authorization; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if further requirements are imposed by the Commissioner under section 53(1)(a), for the purpose of enabling compliance with the requirements. (Replaced 21 of 2016 s. 19)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subsection (1B) applies if the protected product consists of information described in section 23(3)(a), 24(3)(b)(i) or (ii), 26(3)(b)(i) or 27(3)(b)(i) or (ii). (Added 21 of 2016 s. 19)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Despite section 23(3)(a) or 26(3)(b)(i) or any requirement in an order made under section 24(3)(b) or 27(3)(b), the head of the department concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must immediately notify the Commissioner of the case;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make arrangements to ensure that the information is retained; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must—

subparagraph.content: if the Commissioner notifies the head of the department that the Commissioner will not require the provision of the information under section 53(1)(a), cause the immediate destruction of the information; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if the Commissioner requires the provision of the information under section 53(1)(a)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: provide the information as required; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: cause the immediate destruction of the information when it is no longer required by the Commissioner. (Added 21 of 2016 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Where any protected product described in subsection (1) contains any information that is subject to legal professional privilege, subsection (1)(c) is to be construed as also requiring the head of the department concerned to make arrangements to ensure that any part of the protected product that contains the information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a prescribed authorization for a postal interception or covert surveillance, is destroyed not later than 1 year after its retention ceases to be necessary for the purposes of any civil or criminal proceedings before any court that are pending or are likely to be instituted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a prescribed authorization for a telecommunications interception, is as soon as reasonably practicable destroyed.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, something is necessary for the relevant purpose of a prescribed authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of subsection (1)(a), if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it continues to be, or is likely to become, necessary for the relevant purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of a prescribed authorization for a telecommunications interception, it is necessary for the purposes of any civil or criminal proceedings before any court that are pending or are likely to be instituted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of subsection (1)(c)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: when it continues to be, or is likely to become, necessary for the relevant purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of a prescribed authorization for a telecommunications interception, at any time before the expiration of 1 year after it ceases to be necessary for the purposes of any civil or criminal proceedings before any court that are pending or are likely to be instituted.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Record keeping

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 59, each department shall keep a record which is to contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each application for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization under this Ordinance by any officer of the department, a record of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application (including a copy of any affidavit or statement provided under Part 3 for the purposes of the application); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination in respect of the application by the relevant authority (including a copy of any prescribed authorization issued or renewed under Part 3 as a result of the application);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each application for confirmation of an emergency authorization by any officer of the department as provided for in section 23(1), a record of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application (including a copy of any affidavit provided under section 23(2)(b) or, where section 28 applies, a copy of any record, affidavit or other document provided as described in section 28(1)(b), for the purposes of the application); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination in respect of the application by a panel judge (including a copy of any endorsement made or, where section 28 applies, a copy of any emergency authorization issued, under section 24(5) as a result of the application);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each application for confirmation of a prescribed authorization or renewal by any officer of the department as provided for in section 26(1), a record of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application (including a copy of any record, affidavit or statement provided under section 26(2)(b) for the purposes of the application); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination in respect of the application by the relevant authority (including a copy of any prescribed authorization issued or renewed under section 27(5) as a result of the application);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a record of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any case in which any interception or covert surveillance has been discontinued by any officer of the department under section 57; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any case in which any prescribed authorization has been revoked under section 57 further to the discontinuance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of each application for the issue of a device retrieval warrant under section 33 by any officer of the department, a record of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application (including a copy of any affidavit provided under section 33(2)(b) for the purposes of the application); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination in respect of the application by a panel judge (including a copy of any device retrieval warrant issued under section 34(3) as a result of the application);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a record of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any case to which section 23(3) applies by reason that no application for confirmation of an emergency authorization is made within the period of 48 hours by any officer of the department;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any case to which section 26(3) applies by reason that no application for confirmation of a prescribed authorization or renewal is made within the period of 48 hours by any officer of the department; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any findings in respect of any other irregularities and errors identified or detected by any officer of the department, whether in any regular review conducted under section 56(1) and (2) or otherwise; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any record reasonably required to be kept by the department to enable the Commissioner to prepare reports for submission to the Chief Executive under section 49, or otherwise to perform any of his functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The record kept under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to the extent that it relates to any prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is to be retained for a period of at least 2 years after the day on which the prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant (as the case may be) has ceased to have effect; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: without prejudice to subparagraph (i), where it has come to the notice of the department concerned that any relevant civil or criminal proceedings before any court are pending or are likely to be instituted, or any relevant review is being conducted under section 41, or, in the case of a prescribed authorization, any relevant application for an examination has been made under section 43, is to be retained—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of any pending proceedings, review or application, for a period of at least 1 year after the pending proceedings, review or application has been finally determined or finally disposed of; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of any proceedings which are likely to be instituted, for a period of at least 1 year after they have been finally determined or finally disposed of or, if applicable, for a period of at least 1 year after they are no longer likely to be instituted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the extent that it does not relate to any prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant, is to be retained for a period of at least 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), any proceedings, review or application is, in relation to any part of a record that relates to any prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant, regarded as relevant if, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant (as the case may be) is or may be relevant to the determination of any question for the purposes of the proceedings, review or application (as the case may be); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a prescribed authorization, any protected product obtained pursuant to the prescribed authorization is or may be relevant to the determination of any question for the purposes of the proceedings, review or application (as the case may be).

section.name: s61
section.heading: Non-admissibility of telecommunications interception product

subsection.content: Any telecommunications interception product shall not be admissible in evidence in any proceedings before any court other than to prove that a relevant offence has been committed.

Any telecommunications interception product, and any particulars as to a telecommunications interception carried out pursuant to a relevant prescribed authorization, shall not be made available to any party to any proceedings before any court (other than any such proceedings instituted for a relevant offence).

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings before any court (other than any such proceedings instituted for a relevant offence), any evidence or question which tends to suggest any of the following matters shall not be adduced or asked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that an application has been made for the issue or renewal of a relevant prescribed authorization, or the issue of a relevant device retrieval warrant, under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a relevant prescribed authorization has been issued or renewed, or a relevant device retrieval warrant has been issued, under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that any requirement has been imposed on any person to provide assistance for the execution of a relevant prescribed authorization or a relevant device retrieval warrant;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that any information has been obtained pursuant to a relevant prescribed authorization.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (2) or any other provision of this Ordinance, where, for the purposes of any criminal proceedings (whether being criminal proceedings instituted for an offence or any related proceedings), any information obtained pursuant to a relevant prescribed authorization and continuing to be available to the department concerned might reasonably be considered capable of undermining the case for the prosecution against the defence or of assisting the case for the defence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the department shall disclose the information to the prosecution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the prosecution shall then disclose the information to the judge in an ex parte hearing that is held in private.

subsection.content: The judge may, further to the disclosure to him of the information under subsection (4)(b), make such orders as he thinks fit for the purpose of securing the fairness of the proceedings.

Where any order is made under subsection (5) in any criminal proceedings, the prosecution shall disclose to the judge for any related proceedings the terms of the order and the information concerned in an ex parte hearing that is held in private.
Notwithstanding subsection (5), no order made under that subsection authorizes or requires anything to be done in contravention of subsections (1), (2) and (3).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: judge (法官), in relation to any proceedings, means the judge or magistrate before whom those proceedings are or are to be heard, or any other judge or magistrate having jurisdiction to deal with the matter concerned;

related proceedings (有關法律程序), in relation to any criminal proceedings, means any further proceedings (including appeal proceedings) arising from, or any proceedings preliminary or incidental to, those proceedings;
relevant device retrieval warrant (有關器材取出手令) means a device retrieval warrant for the retrieval of any of the devices authorized to be used under a relevant prescribed authorization;

relevant offence (有關罪行) means any offence constituted by the disclosure of any telecommunications interception product or of any information relating to the obtaining of any telecommunications interception product (whether or not there are other constituent elements of the offence);
relevant prescribed authorization (有關訂明授權) means a prescribed authorization for a telecommunications interception;

def.name: TelecommunicationsInterceptionProduct
def.leadIn: telecommunications interception product (電訊截取成果) means any interception product to the extent that it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any contents of a communication that have been obtained pursuant to a relevant prescribed authorization; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of such contents.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Information subject to legal professional privilege to remain privileged
section.content: Any information that is subject to legal professional privilege is to remain privileged notwithstanding that it has been obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Code of practice

subsection.content: The Secretary for Security shall issue a code of practice for the purpose of providing practical guidance to officers of the departments in respect of matters provided for in this Ordinance.
Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Secretary for Security may in the code of practice specify the form of any application to be made to a panel judge under this Ordinance.

The Secretary for Security may from time to time revise the whole or any part of the code of practice, in a manner consistent with his power to issue the code under this section, and, unless the context otherwise requires, any reference to the code of practice, whether in this Ordinance or otherwise, is to be construed as a reference to the code as so revised.
Any officer of a department shall, in performing any function under or for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, comply with the provisions of the code of practice.

subsection.leadIn: A failure on the part of any person to comply with any provision of the code of practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is for all purposes not of itself to be regarded as a failure to comply with any provision of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), does not affect the validity of any prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Prescribed authorizations and device retrieval warrants not affected by minor defects

subsection.content: A prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant is not affected by any minor defect relating to it.

Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), any information (including any protected product) obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization is not by reason only of any minor defect relating to the prescribed authorization to be rendered inadmissible in evidence in any proceedings before any court.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, any reference to minor defect, in relation to a prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant, includes any defect or irregularity, other than a substantial defect or irregularity, in or in connection with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue, or the purported issue, of that prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant or of a document purporting to be that prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the execution, or the purported execution, of that prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant or of a document purporting to be that prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a person shall not incur any civil or criminal liability by reason only of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any conduct carried out pursuant to a prescribed authorization or device retrieval warrant (including any conduct incidental to such conduct);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his performance or purported performance in good faith of any function under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: his compliance with a requirement made or purportedly made under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) affects any liability that is or may be incurred by any person by reason only of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any entry onto any premises without permission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interference with any property without permission.

section.name: s65A
section.heading: Protected products obtained after revocation of prescribed authorization

subsection.content: If a prescribed authorization or a part of a prescribed authorization is revoked under section 24(3)(a)(i), 27(3)(a)(i), 58(2) or 58A(4), the head of the department concerned must make arrangements to ensure that the interception or covert surveillance concerned or the relevant part of the interception or covert surveillance concerned is discontinued as soon as reasonably practicable.

Any protected product that is obtained after the prescribed authorization concerned or the relevant part of the prescribed authorization concerned is revoked and before the interception or covert surveillance concerned or the relevant part of the interception or covert surveillance concerned is discontinued in accordance with the arrangements made by the head of the department concerned under subsection (1) is, for the purposes of this Ordinance, to be regarded as having been obtained pursuant to a prescribed authorization.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Regulation
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, subject to the approval of the Legislative Council, make regulations for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the better carrying out of the purposes of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), prescribing any matter which this Ordinance provides is, or may be, prescribed by regulation made under this section.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, subject to the approval of the Legislative Council, amend Schedules 1, 2, 3 and 4 by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Transitional arrangements

subsection.leadIn: Where any materials have been obtained by or on behalf of any department by carrying out any telecommunications interception pursuant to an order issued or renewed before the commencement* of this Ordinance under section 33 of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), section 59 applies, with necessary modifications, to the materials, to the extent that they are any of the contents of the communication intercepted or a copy of such contents, as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the order were a prescribed authorization issued or renewed under this Ordinance, and accordingly—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the materials were protected product; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the application for the issue or renewal of the order were an application for the issue or renewal of a prescribed authorization under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purpose sought to be furthered by carrying out the operation required to be carried out under the order were the relevant purpose of the order.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) is in addition to and not in derogation of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).
Nothing in this section operates to validate or authorize any telecommunications interception carried out pursuant to an order referred to in subsection (1).

def.name: Copy
def.leadIn: In this section, copy (文本), in relation to any contents of a communication referred to in subsection (1), means any of the following (whether or not in documentary form)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any copy, extract or summary of such contents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any record referring to the telecommunications interception referred to in subsection (1) which is a record showing, directly or indirectly, the identity of any person who is the sender or intended recipient of the communication.

heading.inline: Departments Specified for Covert Surveillance, etc.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Procedures of, and Others Matters relating to, Panel Judge

section.name: s1
section.heading: Provisions for consideration of applications by panel judge

subsection.content: A panel judge shall consider any application made to him under this Ordinance in private.
Without prejudice to subsection (1), the application may, where the panel judge so directs, be considered outside the court precincts at any place other than the premises of a department.
The panel judge may consider the application in such manner as he considers appropriate.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Further powers of panel judge
section.content: For the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance, a panel judge may administer oaths and take affidavits.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Provisions for documents and records compiled by or made available to panel judge

subsection.content: A panel judge shall cause all documents and records compiled by, or made available to, him for any purpose related to the performance of any of his functions under this Ordinance to be kept in a packet sealed by his order, as soon as they are no longer immediately required for the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a panel judge to whom any documents or records are made available in the circumstances described in that subsection shall—

subparagraph.name: a
b
subparagraph.content: cause the copy so certified to be made available to the department concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Where any documents or records are kept in a packet under subsection (1)—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: the packet is to be kept in a secure place specified by a panel judge;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: the packet may not be opened, and the documents or records may not be removed from the packet, except pursuant to an order of a panel judge made for the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance (including those performed at the request of the Commissioner under section 53(2) of this Ordinance); and

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: the packet, and the documents or records, may not be destroyed except pursuant to an order of a panel judge.

subsection.leadIn: Where any packet is opened pursuant to any order of a panel judge referred to in subsection (3)(b)—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: if any documents or records have been removed from the packet, the panel judge shall cause the documents or records to be returned to be kept in the packet, as soon as they are no longer immediately required for the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: the panel judge shall cause the packet to be sealed by his order, as soon as access to the documents or records kept in it is no longer immediately required for the purpose of performing any of his functions under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of subsection (3) apply, with necessary modifications, to the packet so sealed as they apply to the packet referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.content: Nothing in this section prevents any of the documents and records referred to in subsection (1), or any copies of such documents and records, to be made available to the department concerned, whether for the purposes of any relevant written determination provision or pursuant to an order of a panel judge.

subsection.def: In this section, relevant written determination provision (有關書面決定條文) means section 9(3), 12(3), 24(5) (whether with or without reference to section 28 of this Ordinance), 27(5) or 34(3) of this Ordinance.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Requirements for Affidavit or Statement for Application for Issue or Renewal of Prescribed Authorization for Interception or Covert Surveillance

heading.inline: Application for Issue of Judge’s Authorization for Interception

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: An affidavit supporting an application for the issue of a judge’s authorization for interception is to—

subsection.name: a
b
